Char Alexander is one of the tourist areas in Laxmipur where you can immerse yourself in the beauty of the Meghna Embankment and river. This charming destination, named after an English revenue collector named Alexander, offers a serene escape from the hustle and bustle of everyday life. As you explore Char Alexander, you will be captivated by the picturesque green fields surrounding you, the gentle waves of the clouds brushing against the dam, and the breathtaking beauty of nature. In addition to the Meghna Embankment and river, there are other attractions worth visiting in Char Alexander. The Chairman Ghat offers a tranquil spot to relax and enjoy the view, while Suvarna Char and Nuru Patwari Char are also worth exploring. Spending an afternoon in perfect harmony with nature and witnessing the mesmerizing sunset will surely rejuvenate your soul and provide a much-needed break from the monotony of work life. While you are here, don’t miss the opportunity to try the delicious buffalo milk yogurt available in Char Alexander. Its creamy texture and rich flavor will leave you wanting more. To reach Char Alexander, you can take a bus from Sayedabad bus terminal in Dhaka to Laxmipur. The journey takes approximately 4-5 hours, and the fare ranges from Tk 400 to Tk 800 per person. From Laxmipur Jhumur Cinema Hall, you can take a local bus to Alexander Ghat, which will cost around Tk 50. Alternatively, you can also reach Char Alexander by taking a bus from Chittagong to Ramgati and then proceeding to Alexander Launch Ghat. If you prefer a more direct route, you can take a bus from Dhaka to Sonapur and then transfer to a Suvarnachar Express bus or CNG to reach Chairman Ghat in Char Alexander. With its stunning natural beauty and peaceful ambiance, Char Alexander is a must-visit destination for those seeking tranquility amidst nature’s embrace.

Offers a variety of attractions and amenities for you to enjoy during your visit. One of the main highlights of the park is the range of water activities available. You can have a thrilling experience riding the water bumper cars or take a ride on the speedboats, feeling the wind in your hair as you zip across the water. The park also features a water pool where you can relax and listen to the soothing sound of the waves. When it comes to food options, the park’s restaurant is sure to satisfy your taste buds. You can indulge in a delicious array of dishes including Chinese and Bengali cuisine, freshly made chapatis, mouthwatering fuchka, and delectable ice cream. Whether you’re craving something savory or sweet, the restaurant has something to please every palate. If you’re planning to stay overnight, Dream Holiday Park has accommodation facilities available for you and your family. The park offers a range of comfortable rooms where you can relax and unwind after a fun-filled day. Additionally, the park has its own luxury cottages, allowing you to choose the perfect accommodation option that suits your needs. Dream Holiday Park truly has something for everyone. From exciting water activities to delectable food options and comfortable accommodation facilities, this park is the perfect destination for a dream vacation.

A traditional palace complex built in the 19th century that is a testament to the glory of the zamindars of that time. The complex is spread across an area of 16,554 square meters and features four multi-storey buildings that showcase exquisite craftsmanship and fine construction techniques. The lime-surkey, iron plates, and clay used in the construction of the buildings contribute to their durability, with walls that are about 20 inches thick. The complex is now preserved and managed by the Bangladesh Archaeological Department.

A prime example of Mughal architecture, the Idrakpur Fort was built in 1660 by Mir Jumla to protect the area from mug pirates and Portuguese invaders. The fort spans an impressive length of 82 meters and a width of 72 meters. Its architectural features are truly remarkable. The circular fence surrounding each corner of the fort, along with the arched door on the north side, adds to its grandeur. The walls are peppered with holes, cleverly designed for firing at enemies. A circular platform can be found in the middle of the main wall on the east side, allowing for monitoring of enemy movement from a distance.

A mesmerizing place that offers much more than just scenic beauty. One aspect that makes Balikhela unique is its traditional handicrafts. The locals here are skilled artisans who create exquisite handicrafts using traditional techniques. From intricately woven baskets to beautifully painted pottery, you can find a wide variety of handicrafts that showcase the rich cultural heritage of the area. When it comes to cuisine, Balikhela has a distinct local flavor that you must try. The traditional dishes of this region are a treat for your taste buds. From mouth-watering fish curries to delicious rice dishes, the local cuisine is sure to leave you wanting more. Don’t miss out on trying the famous ‘pitha’ – a sweet or savory rice cake that is a specialty of the region. In addition to its handicrafts and cuisine, Balikhela is known for its vibrant cultural festivals. Throughout the year, the locals celebrate various festivals that showcase their traditions and beliefs. From the colorful Baisakhi festival to the lively Jatra performances, there is always something happening in Balikhela that will immerse you in the local culture. Whether you’re interested in traditional handicrafts, local cuisine, or cultural festivals, Balikhela has it all. So, make sure to include this enchanting place in your itinerary when you visit Kishoreganj district.

A magnificent zamindar house that offers a plethora of exploration opportunities, with its historical significance and architectural marvel. Spread over eight acres of land, the Mohera Jamindar Bari is a sight to behold. The three main buildings, along with the naib sahib’s house, kasari ghar, gomastad’s house, and three lodges, showcase the grandeur and opulence of the zamindar era. The presence of small parks, a zoo, picnic spots, and boat rides around the landlord’s house only adds to the charm and allure of this place. One of the highlights of this zamindar house is the Vishakha Sagar, a dighi that sits majestically before the entrance. It serves as a reminder of the historical significance of this place and its connection to the zamindar’s legacy. Additionally, the Pasra Pond and Rani Pond located at the back of the main building offer a serene and tranquil setting for visitors to enjoy.

A special stone plaque written in Arabic on the Gerda Mosque’s western wall, known as the Gerda Folok. It is believed that the Gerda Mosque was originally built around this plaque written in 1013 AD or 1604 AD. The plaque was built on a fraction of an ancient mosque built by Shah Ali Baghdadi.

Established in 1930 by Ras Bihari Parvat, this garden covers about 26 acres of land and is located on the banks of the Kumar River in Mostafapur Union of Madaripur Sadar Upazila. The garden boasts around 500 species of trees, both native and foreign. You’ll find coconut, betel nut, mango, jam, jackfruit, kamranga, amra, kul, safeda, olive, amla, orange, and jamrul trees, among others. These trees not only add to the charm of the garden but also provide shade and a refreshing atmosphere. Additionally, Parbat Bagan is adorned with roses, barley, gandaraj, bakul, and other flowers, making it a feast for the eyes. Besides its botanical diversity, Parbat Bagan holds historical significance. It was a favored destination for high-ranking officials of Madaripur sub-division in the past. The garden’s association with Ras Bihari Parvat, who planted the trees, and the presence of a two-story residence, a temple, and the mausoleums of Ras Bihari Parvat and his parents add to its historical value.
Location: Mostafapur Union of Madaripur Sadar Upazila

Description: This is the ancestral home of the famous Bengali poet and novelist Sunil Gangopadhyay. The house is located in the village of Faridpur in Madaripur district. The house is a two-story building with a large courtyard. The house has been preserved as a museum and is open to visitors.

This is a historical palace located in the village of Khalia in Madaripur district. The palace was built in the early 19th century by the local zamindar (landlord) and is a fine example of the architecture of that period. The palace has been preserved and is open to visitors.
This is a large lake located in the village of Senapati in Madaripur district. The lake is surrounded by lush greenery and is a popular spot for picnics and boating.

This is a historical palace located in the village of Mithapur in Madaripur district. The palace was built in the early 19th century by the local zamindar (landlord) and is a fine example of the architecture of that period. The palace has been preserved and is open to visitors.
This is a Hindu temple located in the village of Ganesh Pagol in Madaripur district. The temple is dedicated to Lord Ganesh and is a popular pilgrimage site for Hindus.
This is a small lake located in the village of Shokuni in Madaripur district. The lake is surrounded by lush greenery and is a popular spot for picnics and boating.

This is a historical building located in the village of Auliapur in Madaripur district. The building was used as a residence by the local zamindar (landlord) and is a fine example of the architecture of that period. The building has been preserved and is open to visitors.

The Mahisar Digumbori Dighi is a popular pilgrimage site for Hindus. Locals believe that bathing in its waters can cleanse sins and diseases. This 600-year-old dighi holds immense historical significance and is a witness to the rich cultural heritage of the region. It was dug by Raja Chand Roy, the zamindar of Bikrampur Pargana, at the request of the monks of Digambari. Surrounding the dighi are various structures, including the Digambari Sanyasi Bari, Mela Chattar, Jora Pukur, Mansa Temple, Kali Mandir Chattar, and Lakshmi Temple. The dighi is not only a site for religious rituals but also a treasure trove of archaeological artifacts. During the re-excavation in 1982, many rare artifacts were discovered, including a 42 kg statue. These artifacts provide insights into the historical and cultural practices of the people who lived here centuries ago. The locals hold deep reverence for the dighi and believe in its spiritual powers. They flock to the dighi from far and wide to bathe in its holy waters, seeking purification and healing. Saturdays and Tuesdays are particularly important days for worship, and the Hindu community organizes special ceremonies on the banks of the dighi. In addition to its religious significance, the Mahisar Digumbori Dighi has become a major tourist attraction. The Baishakhi Fair and Puja of Mahishar, held on Pahela Baishakh, draw thousands of devotees and visitors from both home and abroad. The dighi’s serene surroundings and the presence of guest birds in winter add to its natural beauty, making it a must-visit destination.
Located in Vedarganj upazila of Shariatpur district, Burir Hat Jame Masjid is an exquisite example of Islamic architecture in Bangladesh.
Rudrakar Moth is a Hindu temple located in the village of Rudrakar in Shariatpur district. The temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva and is a popular pilgrimage site for Hindus.

Sureswar Darbar Sharif is a shrine located in the village of Sureswar in Shariatpur district. The shrine is dedicated to Sufi saint Hazrat Shah Sufi Syed Sureswar. The shrine is visited by people of all religions and is a symbol of communal harmony.

Dhanuka Manasha Bari is a historical house located in the village of Dhanuka in Shariatpur district. The house was built in the early 19th century by the local zamindar (landlord) and is a fine example of the architecture of that period. The house has been preserved and is open to visitors.

Modern Fantasy Kingdom is an amusement park located in the village of Bhozeshwar in Shariatpur district. The park features a variety of rides and attractions, including a roller coaster, a Ferris wheel, a water park, and a haunted house.

Murshid Jamai Pagol Mazar Sharif is a popular shrine in Rajbari known for its miraculous healing powers. People from all walks of life visit this sacred place seeking relief from their troubles and ailments. The shrine is believed to have been established by a man wearing a nengti in the 1960s, who took up residence under the sheora tree. Since then, countless miracles have been attributed to him. One of the most famous miracles associated with the shrine is the story of a dumb girl who was married off to a madman. After spending the first night as husband and wife, the girl miraculously regained her speech. However, the mad son-in-law disappeared and was eventually found in Aladipur. From that moment on, the name ‘son-in-law crazy’ became well-known in the area. The healing powers of Murshid Jamai Pagol are said to extend beyond the realm of speech. It is believed that he healed many people suffering from cholera when he first arrived in Aladipur. As word spread about his abilities, more and more people came to him seeking relief from various dangers and problems. It is said that if someone shared their troubles with him, he would repeat their words and provide a solution. Over the years, the shrine has been cared for by different individuals. After the death of the son-in-law madman, a visitor took charge of the funeral arrangements and a shrine was built in his honor. Later, a man named Noor Baker Shah became the caretaker, followed by Gauri Pagli. These shrine caretakers have played a vital role in maintaining the sacredness of the place and ensuring that the rituals and traditions are upheld. Inside the shrine, there are separate graves for Murshid Jamai Pagol, Nur Baker Shah, and Gauri Pagli. The premises also boast a magnificent mosque, where devotees gather to offer prayers and seek blessings.

Rajbari Government High School is a historic school located in Rajbari district. The school was established in 1836 and is one of the oldest schools in Bangladesh. The school has a rich history and has produced many notable alumni over the years. The school building is an impressive structure and is a fine example of colonial architecture.

Mir Mosharraf Hossain Memorial Center is a museum dedicated to the life and works of the famous Bengali author Mir Mosharraf Hossain. The museum is located in the village of Lahinipara in Rajbari district. The museum houses a collection of artifacts related to the author, including his personal belongings, manuscripts, and photographs. The museum also has a library that contains a large collection of books and journals on Bengali literature.

Kalyan Dhigi is a historical site located in Rajbari district. The site is believed to have been built during the reign of the Sena dynasty in the 12th century. The site consists of a large pond surrounded by a brick wall. The pond is believed to have been used for bathing by the royal family. The site is also home to a temple dedicated to Lord Shiva.

Jor Bangla Mandir is a historic temple located in Rajbari district. The temple was built in the 17th century by Raja Sitaram Ray in Nolia village, Jamalpur union. The temple is an ancient temple following an old Hindu architectural design.

Thawe Temple, also known as the Temple of Maa Thawewali, is located in Thawe, Bihar, India. It is situated only 6 km from Gopalganj town on the Gopalganj-Siwan National Highway. The temple is dedicated to Goddess Durga and is a popular pilgrimage site for Hindus.

Lalbagh Fort is a 17th-century Mughal fort complex located in Dhaka, Bangladesh. The fort was built in 1678 by Prince Muhammad Azam, the third son of Emperor Aurangzeb. The fort complex consists of three main buildings: the Diwan-i-Aam, the Diwan-i-Khas, and the Tomb of Pari Bibi. The fort is open to visitors and is a popular tourist attraction in Dhaka.
Location: Lalbagh Rd, Dhaka City, Dhaka, Bangladesh

A historical spot in Jhenaidah that attracts many visitors. It was built during the Sultani era in the 16th century by Khan Jahan Ali and holds significant historical value. The mosque has a stunning design with its six dome-shaped walls, beautifully decorated semi-circular mihrabs, and two stone minarets. The surrounding area of Golakata Dighi adds to the charm of the mosque. According to legends, the Dighi got its name from a cruel king of Barobazar who would throw his subjects into the Dighi after cutting their throats. The Golakata Mosque not only preserves artifacts from the 15th century but also showcases the architectural brilliance of that era.

This historical house holds immense historical value and is renowned for its architectural features. The house has been renovated over the years to preserve its heritage. K.P. Basu’s house is a testament to the rich cultural legacy of Jhenaidah. The house showcases intricate designs and skilled craftsmanship, combining traditional and modern elements in a unique way.

A beautiful mosque located in Shailkupa Upazila of Jhenaidah district. It was built during the Mughal period and is known for its unique architectural style. The mosque has a large courtyard and a beautiful garden.

A beautiful mosque located in Jor Bangla village of Jhenaidah district. It was built during the Mughal period and is known for its unique architectural style. The mosque has a large courtyard and a beautiful garden.

A beautiful zamindar house located in Shailkupa Upazila of Jhenaidah district. It was built during the British period and is known for its unique architectural style. The house has a large courtyard and a beautiful garden.

A beautiful banyan tree located in Mollickpur village of Jhenaidah district. It is one of the largest banyan trees in Bangladesh and is estimated to be over 200 years old. The tree has a large canopy and provides a cool shade to visitors.
A beautiful lake located in Jhenaidah district. It is a popular picnic spot and attracts many visitors. The lake has a large area and is surrounded by lush green trees.
A perfect picnic spot located in Naldanga Upazila of Jhenaidah district. The resort has a large area and is surrounded by lush green trees. It is a popular destination for families and friends.
A lively market located in Jhenaidah district. It is known for its vibrant atmosphere and is a popular destination for shopping.
A charming building located in Jhenaidah district. It was built during the British period and is known for its unique architectural style. The building has a large courtyard and a beautiful garden.

Place Name: Johan Drim Valley Park and Resort
Description: A popular amusement park located in Jhenaidah district. It has a large area and is surrounded by lush green trees. The park has many rides and attractions for visitors of all ages.

The main attraction of Narail Badha Ghat is a camp built on a tall column, where locals come to relax and have a good time. This ghat is really important to the culture of the area and has a long and interesting history. The zamindar of Narail built it so he could enjoy the river and the beautiful scenery around it. The locals call it Rajbari Ghat and there is also the zamindar’s house nearby. Narail Badha Ghat gives people a chance to go boating on the peaceful Chitra river. It’s a great way to enjoy the calmness of the area and see the pretty landscape. This ghat is a reminder of the region’s past and it attracts both locals and tourists.

Niharranjan Gupta’s house, situated in Itna village of Lohagara Upazila, is a cherished treasure recognized by the Bangladesh Archaeology Department in 2003. This old house holds great historical importance because of its rich heritage and exceptional wooden craftsmanship. As you enter, you will be mesmerized by the intricate wooden designs of flowers and vines that adorn the doors, windows, and wall cabinets. The house has three rooms, a temple with a porch, and a narrow porch with seven rooms and arches. The dedicated preservation team has ensured that this architectural gem remains intact, even after the passing of time.

The Sultan Complex is a group of buildings located in the heart of Narail town. It was built during the reign of Sultan Ghiyasuddin Azam Shah in the 15th century. The complex consists of a mosque, a tomb, and a palace. The mosque is a beautiful example of Mughal architecture and has intricate designs and carvings. The tomb is the final resting place of Sultan Ghiyasuddin Azam Shah and is a popular destination for visitors. The palace is now in ruins but still holds great historical value.

Shopnobithi Picnic Spot is a popular destination for families and friends. It is located in the heart of Narail town and has a large area for picnics and other outdoor activities. The park has many rides and attractions for visitors of all ages.

Niribili Picnic Spot is another popular destination for families and friends. It is located in the heart of Narail town and has a large area for picnics and other outdoor activities. The park has many rides and attractions for visitors of all ages.

A historical site located in Kumarkhali, Kushtia. It was the residence of Rabindranath Tagore during his visits to East Bengal. The place has been converted into a museum and displays various artifacts related to Tagore’s life and work. The museum is open to visitors throughout the year, but it is best to visit during the 25th Baishakh of Bangla calendar (8th of May) when a large village fair is organized there .

The shrine of Fakir Lalon Shah is located in Kumarkhali Upazila of the Kushtia district. Lalon Shah was a famous philosopher and poet who lived in the 19th century. The shrine is revered for its spiritual significance and attracts many visitors. The best time to visit is during the Dol purnima of the 11th month of Bangla calendar (which is usually between February-March) .

A small mosque located in Kushtia district which is worth a visit. It is not that much popular amongst the tourists who visit Kushtia. But if you are a fan of Mughal architecture and history then this mosque is for you. It takes about an hour to reach near the mosque using public transportation .

A village located near Kushtia town where people weave cloth using handlooms. During your visit, you can see how they are doing the weaving, how their life is, and many more. If you are a fan of off-road tourists activities then this is the activity for you .
A small building located in Millpara of Kushtia town. It is a duplex building that was used by the poet Rabindranath Tagore .
A popular picnic spot located in the heart of Kushtia. The park is beautifully landscaped and has a children’s playground, a mini-zoo, and a lake where you can enjoy boating .
